message: it gets really nice and sunny from August - November
so it's a late summer
and it's really rainy from Jan - Mar
I'm considering moving to SF, but I have a huge curiosity. What's the wheater like in SF? It's always spring-summer? The min/max temperature in the year? Tnx! :P
most of the year is 60 - 70 degrees F
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco#Climate
Also depends on what neighborhood you're in.
and it's freezing cold and foggy in August.
@spencer - So true. I work in SOMA and live on the Inner Sunset Side of Mt. Sutro where the fog gets so thick I can't see past my balcony.  This is such an awesome town!
Last August it was 100F in SoMA at lunchtime, then at home (Lower Pac Heights) I'd get blasted in the face by cold sea fog at 5pm. That's part of what I like about it here - always changing.

@BikerBecca it's so cool. I was unemployed at the time so usually home around 4. I'd see it come over Sutro then I'd run up to Lafayette Sq park to watch it whip up the hill and straight up into clouds. Nuts!
Thanks guys. I don't know but I've imaginated the California as always cold and sunny. All the California has the weather of SF or is different?
The SFBA is a fairly special climate.
@coderanger oh interesting

Yeah, it varies quite a bit around the state... there's some good info from Pacific Gas and Electric here http://www.pge.com/mybusiness/edusafety/training/pec/toolbox/arch/climate/index.shtml But basically, SF has a bunch of microclimates depending on whether you're on the ocean side, bay side, blocked by a hill, etc.
@ccarnino - San Francisco has it's own Micro-Climate which is the cause of it's world famous fog and Mark Twain quote about his coldest winter being summer in San Francisco.
This is very curious :)
Understood.
@ccarnino in short, the weather here is insane, considering 400 miles south they barely get seasons at all!

Oh, and check out http://www.wunderground.com/auto/wxmap/CA/San_Francisco.html. It has "crowd sourced" weather data from personal measurement stations around the city. At the moment, the readings vary from 49F to 62F :-)

...but if you really want to see averages/records, there's http://weatherspark.com/#graphs;a=USA/CA_94110/San_Francisco which graphs all the day you'd ever want. It's not by neighborhood, however, it's just lumping the whole city togeter.
Thanks all guys!
@kshep cool I've bookmarked that!
